newsitem.title: UK: Oxford Molecular has option to buy Cambridge.
newsitem.headline: Oxford Molecular has option to buy Cambridge.

text.p: British drug software and contract research firm Oxford Molecular Group Plc said on Monday it had been granted an option to acquire the bulk of the share capital of drug research company Cambridge Combinatorial.
Oxford agreed to subscribe 2.0 million stg in cash for non-voting redeemable preference shares in Cambridge.

This gives it the right, but not obligation, to acquire 78.01 percent of Cambridge's issued ordinary share capital. Oxford took up a 19.99 percent stake in February. Cambridge University Technical Services holds the other 2.00 percent.

The maximum exercise price under the agreement is 23.4 million stg although this does not preclude a purchase being made at a lower price during or after the option period, the company said in a statement.

"Since its foundation, we have collaborated very closely with Cambridge Combinatorial in the area of drug discovery and believe that significant commercial opportunities have been created for both companies," said Oxford Molecular's chief executive Tong Marchington.
Oxford Molecular reported pre-tax losses of 677,000 stg for the six months to June 30, compared with a 928,000 loss in the comparable period the year before.
